sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Nancy Carroll, Helen Kane, Jack Oakie
Directed by: Frank Tuttle
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TUzR3YhpzxOuBM6YrZ91UVG
üçïRARE NANCY CARROLL MUSICAL COMEDYüçï 
From Broadway chorus lines to the silent screen, Nancy Carroll danced her way onto Hollywood‚Äôs A-list. Although she headlined dozens of films, many are now lost to time. That makes Sweetie‚Äîa surviving showcase of her early magic‚Äîa rare reel indeed!

Directed by Frank Tuttle, this Pre-Code musical comedy features an all-star cast led by Nancy Carroll, Helen Kane, known as the original ‚ÄúBoop-Boop-a-Doop‚Äù girl. The film also includes standout performances by Jack Oakie and Wallace MacDonald, delivering the lively charm and wit that defined early talking pictures.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every WEEK on PizzaFLIX.

Sweetie captures the spirit of the late 1920s with toe-tapping musical numbers, spirited college hijinks, and the vibrant style of the early sound era. With choreography that hints at Broadway flair and a cast full of comedic talent, this film offers a delightful window into the transition from silent cinema to talkies.

A must-watch for fans of vintage cinema, classic musicals, and film history.

#fullmovie #Sweetie1929 #NancyCarroll #HelenKane #bettyboop #JackieOakie #PreCodeHollywood #MusicalComedy #Talkies #ParamountPictures #classicmoviemonday #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Stanley Smith is an obscure actor today, but in 1933 he was to take Dick Powell's role in Footlight Parade when Dick got sick with pneumonia. When Dick got well, Stan was out, and he never amounted to much. Judging by his performance in this film, I can see why. He reminds me of Lawrence Gray, who was adequate but lacked that something special that made audiences want to see him again.The film also stars Nancy Carroll who was quite beautiful, Helen Kane who won me over with her cute voice and silly antics (she is introduced sitting in a tree shooting the man she loves), and Jack Oakie who is quite attractive here in this early part, and brimming over with the personality that made him famous. The scenes are incredibly beautiful, mostly set on a college campus, and the music is fun but none of it is very memorable, except for "Alma Mammy" which turns the alma mater into a jazzy Jolson-style number.This college romp was screened at Cinevent in 2012.
metadata.Actors: Nancy Carroll, Helen Kane, Stanley Smith
